Key Match Events: Nathan Lukes double down the left-field line in the eighth inning drove home George Springer with the winning run
Pre-Game Insights: Any sweep is huge in this league
The goal from the beginning of the year to now doesn’t change, regardless of what the standings say. It’s win as many games as you can.
It is nice to have some goals internally
Post-Match Reflections: I hate looking at the standings and seeing where we are, at the bottom of our own division
The guys have been up for it. I don’t want to say it’s easy to go through the motions. I think there are teams we have played where we have ‘out-energied’ them, if that’s the right word.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Davis Schneider hit a two-run homer in the fourth
Zach Pop picked up the win
Chad Green picked up his 17th save
Vladimir Guerrero Jr., had the chance to add to his 500 career RBIs taken away in both the sixth and eighth innings
Others: St. Louis' Miles Mikolas and Toronto's Yariel Rodriguez kept it close early
The right-hander remains on a pitch count after having sat out all of last season in order to make the jump from Japan to the majors

Asked through an interpreter how difficult it is to be patient in those circumstances, Rodriguez relayed that it’s just part of the plan the team set up for him at the beginning of the year to build him back up after that lost season
